voucher.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a ticket that can be used instead of money for a particular purpose
voucher.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The voucher can be used at most major supermarkets.
First prize is a £1,000 travel voucher.
voucher.translation[0].definitions[1].de: an official statement or receipt that is given to someone to prove that their accounts are correct or that money has been paid
voucher.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a ticket that can be used instead of money for a particular purpose
voucher.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The tour price includes a voucher for a meal in a pub of your choice.
She was given a travel voucher from Belfast to London.
voucher.translation[1].definitions[1].de: money that a government gives people to use for a particular purpose such as health or education
voucher.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The White House is proposing tax credits or vouchers, worth perhaps as much as $5,000 a family, to help low-income people buy health insurance.
The nursery voucher scheme gave parents vouchers worth £1000 to buy the nursery provision of their choice.
voucher.translation[1].definitions[2].de: an official RECEIPT given for money that has been paid
voucher.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: On receiving payment the subcontractor should give the builder a completed voucher.
voucher.translation[1].definitions[3].de: any document that proves that someone’s accounts are correct
